channel.description: Recent content in Reliable Software Systems on Michael Knapp's Home Page

item.title: Version Control
item.description: Code and configuration should be tracked in a version control system.

item.title: Code Quality
item.description: Code should be automatically evaluated by certain quality metrics.

item.title: Separation of Duties
item.description: Code needs to be peer reviewed as a requirement.

item.title: Configuration Management
item.description: It should be possible to reliably re-create your infrastructure from code.

item.title: CICD
item.description: You should have an automated way to build, test, and deploy your applications.

item.title: Testing
item.description: There should be ample automated tests of your system that run routinely.

item.title: Environment Parity
item.description: Your environments should be as similar as possible.

item.title: Application States and Signals
item.description: Your applications should expose health information and be able to gracefully shut down.

item.title: Boot and Shutdown Times
item.description: Applications should boot and shutdown promptly for scaling purposes.

item.title: Stateless
item.description: Your applications should ideally be stateless.

item.title: Deployment Patterns
item.description: You should be able to update your applications safely with zero down-time.

item.title: High Availability
item.description: Your critical applications should be replicated across availability zones and regions. They should automatically scale based on demand.

item.title: Load Balancing
item.description: Traffic to your services should be balanced among your replicas.

item.title: Monitoring
item.description: You should have ample means to investigate, troubleshoot, and observe your system. You should be alerted if it is unhealthy.

item.title: Security
item.description: Your system should follow industry best practices for security and implement defense in depth.

item.title: Documentation
item.description: Thoroughly document your code and services for fellow engineers and end users.
